medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started at 4 AM, located in the midback and radiated to the epigastrium. It is described as severe, sharp, intermittent, and worse when laying supine. The patient has tried taking Tums, aspirin, and her albuterol inhaler with no relief.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, Panic disorder, Depression, Right upper chest/subpleural mass, Obesity, Sleep apnea, history of tobacco abuse, Rhinitis, Thyroid nodules, Sickle cell trait, C-section x2
medical_history.family_history: No history of gallbladder disease; father (deceased) had sleep apnea
